meanings.def: used to introduce the second part of a comparison
examples: There was more whisky in it than soda.
He loves me more than you do.
It was much better than I'd expected.
You should know better than to behave like that.
I'd rather email than phone, if that's OK by you.

meanings.def: used for comparing amounts, numbers, distances, etc.
examples: It never takes more than an hour.
It's less than a mile to the beach.
There were fewer than twenty people there.

meanings.def: used in expressions showing that one thing happens straight after another
examples: No sooner had I sat down than there was a loud knock on the door.
Hardly had we arrived than the problems started.
I don't know any French people other than you.
We're going away in June but other than that I'll be here all summer.

meanings.def: different or in a different way from; not
examples: I have never known him to behave other than selfishly.
I don't know any French people other than you.
We're going away in June but other than that I'll be here all summer.
I have never known him to behave other than selfishly.

related: an ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure
